CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 11, 1969, pg. 16 reads:"Ball Guests - A number of out of towners attended the AKA Ball at the William Penn. Many were former Pittsburghers home for the holiday. Soror LaRue Frederick (standing left), a past regional director of the sorority, introduced the visitors to the present regional director Soror Altha Brown of Wilberforce, Ohio.  Seated from left: Mrs. Judy Pollard Taylor, Hampton, Va.; Mrs. Marjorie Borders, Hartford, Conn.; Mrs. Virginia Winlock, Louisville, Ky.; Mrs. Naomi Hilton, Canonsburg, Pa., and Mrs. Bessie Brannon, Detroit, Mich.  Standing from left: Mrs. Frederick, Dr. and Mrs. Larry Green, Buffalo, N.Y.; Mrs. Carolyn McCraw Carter, Cincinnati, Ohio; Mrs. Brown; Dr. Fred Humphries, Boston, Mass.; Mrs. Antoinette Humphries, Boston; Mrs. Donna Dalton McCall, Hampton, Va.; Mrs. Phyllis Randolph, Philadelphia; Col. and Mrs. Charles Wilson ,Waynesboro, Pa., and Mrs. Arthur Coleman, Philadelphia."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of out of town guests, from left, seated: Judy Pollard Taylor, Marjorie Borders, Virginia Winlock, Naomi Hilton, and Bessie Brannon; standing: LaRue Frederick, Dr. and Mrs. Larry Green, Carolyn McCraw Carter, Altha Brown, Dr. Fred Humphries, Antoinette Humphries, Donna Dalton McCall, Phyllis Randolph, Col. and Mrs. Charles Wilson, and Mrs. Arthur Coleman, posed in William Penn Hotel during Alpha Kappa Alpha holiday formal
